intro: Mentha longifolia var. amphileuca, commonly known as the white mint, is a variant of the spearmint plant characterized by its pale or white leaf coloration. It is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, making it useful in culinary and medicinal applications. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in various growing conditions.
